p: To determine similarities and differences in the transcriptional changes of genes in WZ and HK C. wenyujin, we performed hierarchical clustering, which accordingly revealed differences in the expression patterns of genes in the two sources of C. wenyujin ( Fig 7). A subset of transcripts, together with their respective fold changes and false discovery rate-corrected P-values, for both clusters, are presented in S8 Table. Among these, genes related to terpene, curcumin, and polysaccharide pathways were found to be up-regulated in C. wenyujin from Wenzhou, where genes associated with starch and sugar pathways were up-regulated in C. wenyujin from Haikou.
